title: Rush Project
description: Hotel needs rapid furniture replacement due to unexpected event (fire, acquisition, rebranding deadline)
descriptionNO: Hotell trenger rask møbelerstatning pga. uventet hendelse (brann, oppkjøp, rebranding)
context: Time-critical project requiring maximum speed with acceptable quality compromises
contextNO: Tidskritisk prosjekt som krever maksimal hastighet med akseptable kvalitetskompromisser

primary.name: YLLW FACTORY
primary.rationale: Largest inventory, Stockholm presence, proven hospitality experience, turnkey services
primary.rationaleNO: Største lager, Stockholm-tilstedeværelse, dokumentert hospitality-erfaring, fullservice-tjenester

criticalSuccessFactors: Contact within 48 hours of need identification
Accept 'family of styles' vs. perfect matching
Budget for 10-20% premium on rush orders
Pre-approve quality grades (B-grade acceptable for speed)
criticalSuccessFactorsNO: Kontakt innen 48 timer etter behovsidentifisering
Aksepter 'familie av stiler' vs. perfekt matching
Budsjett for 10-20% premium på rush-ordrer
Forhåndsgodkjenn kvalitetsgrader (B-grade akseptabel for hastighet)

risks.mitigation: Use items in low-risk areas (back office) or guest rooms (lower fire requirements)
risks.mitigationNO: Bruk gjenstander i lavrisiko-områder (backoffice) eller gjesteværelser (lavere brannkrav)

risks.risk: Volume limitations - even large operators may not have 100+ matching items immediately
risks.mitigation: Phased delivery (50 rooms Week 1, 50 rooms Week 4)
risks.riskNO: Volumsbegrensninger - selv store operatører har kanskje ikke 100+ matchende gjenstander umiddelbart
risks.mitigationNO: Fasert levering (50 rom Uke 1, 50 rom Uke 4)

risks.risk: Quality variability due to less selective sourcing
risks.mitigation: Fyra site inspection of warehouse before selection
risks.mitigationNO: Fyra site-inspeksjon av lager før valg

keyConsiderations: Speed is priority over perfect aesthetic match
Fire safety may require strategic room placement
Expect 'family of styles' rather than exact matching
Budget for rush premium and potential phased delivery
keyConsiderationsNO: Hastighet er prioritet over perfekt estetisk match
Brannsikkerhet kan kreve strategisk rom-plassering
Forvent 'familie av stiler' heller enn eksakt matching
Budsjett for haste-premium og potensiell fasert levering

title: Large Hotel Renovation
description: 100-200 room hotel renovation with circular furniture integration
context: Full-scale hotel renovation requiring volume capacity and dual-supplier strategy
contextNO: Fullskala hotellrenovering som krever volumkapasitet og dual-supplier strategi

recommendedSuppliers.rationale: No single operator can reliably deliver 100+ beds
recommendedSuppliers.rationaleNO: Ingen enkelt operatør kan pålitelig levere 100+ senger

estimatedCost: 50-70% of new furniture cost for comparable quality
estimatedCostNO: 50-70% av nye møbler kostnad for sammenlignbar kvalitet

criticalGap.workaround: Source beds new, use circular economy for all other furniture (chairs, tables, storage, lighting)
criticalGap.workaroundNO: Kjøp senger nye, bruk sirkulærøkonomi for alle andre møbler (stoler, bord, oppbevaring, belysning)

criticalSuccessFactors: Engage both YLLW and Input early (9-12 months before construction)
Accept that beds will be new (25-30% of budget)
Design public spaces around available reuse inventory
Build 8-10 week buffer for fire testing coordination
Use framework agreements for volume discounts (15-20% off)
criticalSuccessFactorsNO: Engasjer både YLLW og Input tidlig (9-12 måneder før bygging)
Aksepter at senger vil være nye (25-30% av budsjett)
Design offentlige rom rundt tilgjengelig gjenbrukslager
Bygg inn 8-10 uker buffer for branntesting-koordinering
Bruk rammeavtaler for volumrabatter (15-20% avslag)

risks.risk: Bed frame gap - no reuse solution available
risks.mitigation: Budget for new beds, maximize reuse everywhere else
risks.mitigationNO: Budsjett for nye senger, maksimer gjenbruk andre steder

risks.risk: Fire safety testing delays for upholstered furniture
risks.mitigation: Start fire testing during design development phase
Assign single Fyra PM to coordinate both suppliers
risks.mitigationNO: Tildel én Fyra PM til å koordinere begge leverandører

keyConsiderations: Dual-supplier strategy is necessary for volume
Hotel beds are the primary gap in circular economy supply
Fire safety planning must start early (design phase)
Framework agreements unlock 15-20% volume discounts
Expect 50-70% cost of new furniture
keyConsiderationsNO: Dual-supplier strategi er nødvendig for volum
Hotellsenger er det primære gapet i sirkulærøkonomi-tilbud
Brannsikkerhetsplanlegging må starte tidlig (designfase)
Rammeavtaler låser opp 15-20% volumrabatter
Forvent 50-70% kostnad av nye møbler

title: Boutique High-End Hotel
description: 30-50 room boutique hotel with unique, design-forward circular furniture
descriptionNO: 30-50 roms boutique-hotell med unike, designdrevne sirkulære møbler
context: Design-focused project prioritizing unique pieces over volume matching
contextNO: Designfokusert prosjekt som prioriterer unike stykker fremfor volum-matching

primary.name: YLLW FACTORY
primary.rationale: Curated vintage pieces, refurbishment capability, hospitality experience

secondary.name: KOMPANJONEN
secondary.rationale: Vintage design pieces (Arne Jacobsen, Bruno Mathsson)

estimatedCost: Premium positioning - 60-80% of new designer furniture
criticalSuccessFactors: Embrace 'one-of-a-kind' aesthetic vs. uniformity
Allow 6-9 month lead time for sourcing unique pieces
Budget for premium refurbishment (custom reupholstery, refinishing)
Partner closely with interior designer for item selection
Accept mix of eras/styles unified by color palette or material
criticalSuccessFactorsNO: Omfavn 'one-of-a-kind' estetikk vs. uniformitet
Tillat 6-9 måneder lead time for sourcing av unike stykker
Budsjett for premium remøblering (skreddersydd repolstring, oppussing)
Samarbeid tett med interiørarkitekt for gjenstand-valg
Aksepter mix av epoker/stiler forent av fargepalett eller materiale

risks.risk: Sourcing timeline unpredictability for rare pieces
risks.riskNO: Sourcing tidslinje uforutsigbarhet for sjeldne stykker

risks.risk: Vintage upholstered furniture fire testing costs
risks.mitigation: Use vintage upholstered furniture in guest rooms (lower fire requirements), Tier 1-2 in public areas
risks.mitigationNO: Bruk vintage polstret møbler i gjesteværelser (lavere brannkrav), Tier 1-2 i offentlige områder

risks.risk: Limited matching quantities (may only find 1-2 of each item)
risks.mitigation: Design around uniqueness - different chair at each table becomes intentional aesthetic
risks.riskNO: Begrenset matching antall (finner kanskje bare 1-2 av hver gjenstand)
risks.mitigationNO: Design rundt unikhet - forskjellig stol ved hvert bord blir intensjonell estetikk

keyConsiderations: Uniqueness is asset, not limitation - embrace curated mix
Extended timeline (6-9 months) required for sourcing
Premium refurbishment adds 20-30% to base cost
Fire safety strategy: vintage upholstery in guest rooms, Tier 1-2 in public spaces
Ideal for design-forward brands (Nobis, Ett Hem style)
keyConsiderationsNO: Unikhet er en ressurs, ikke begrensning - omfavn kuratert mix
Forlenget tidslinje (6-9 måneder) påkrevd for sourcing
Premium remøblering legger til 20-30% på basiskostnad
Brannsikkerhetsstrategi: vintage polstring i gjesteværelser, Tier 1-2 i offentlige rom
Ideell for designdrevne merkevarer (Nobis, Ett Hem-stil)

title: Cross-Border Nordic Project
description: Multi-location hotel chain rollout across Nordic countries
descriptionNO: Flerlokasjon hotellkjede-utrulling på tvers av nordiske land
context: Pan-Nordic hotel chain requiring coordinated multi-country sourcing and logistics
contextNO: Pan-nordisk hotellkjede som krever koordinert flerlandsourcing og logistikk

primary.name: INPUT INTERIÖR / GREENIFIED
primary.rationale: Pan-Nordic presence (Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway), enterprise infrastructure
primary.rationaleNO: Pan-nordisk tilstedeværelse (Sverige, Finland, Danmark, Norge), bedriftsinfrastruktur

backup.name: MATER DESIGN
backup.rationale: Copenhagen-based with Nordic reach, recycled materials expertise
backup.rationaleNO: København-basert med nordisk rekkevidde, resirkulert materiale-ekspertise

estimatedCost: Volume discounts (20-25%) offset by cross-border logistics complexity
criticalSuccessFactors: Select supplier with established Nordic network
Standardize furniture packages across locations (reduce sourcing complexity)
Build 12-18 month rollout timeline with location phasing
Negotiate framework agreement for multi-country pricing
Coordinate with local fire authorities in each country (regulations vary)
criticalSuccessFactorsNO: Velg leverandør med etablert nordisk nettverk
Standardiser møbelpakker på tvers av lokasjoner (reduser sourcing-kompleksitet)
Bygg 12-18 måneders utrullings-tidslinje med lokasjonsfasering
Forhandl rammeavtale for flerlandsprising
Koordiner med lokale brannmyndigheter i hvert land (reguleringer varierer)

risks.risk: Varying fire safety regulations across Nordic countries
risks.mitigation: Engage fire consultant early to map BBR (SE) vs. TEK (NO) vs. BR (DK) requirements
risks.riskNO: Varierende brannsikkerhetsreguleringer på tvers av nordiske land
risks.mitigationNO: Engasjer brannskonsulent tidlig for å kartlegge BBR (SE) vs. TEK (NO) vs. BR (DK) krav

risks.risk: Cross-border logistics complexity and customs (post-Brexit considerations)
risks.mitigation: Work with Input's established Nordic logistics network
risks.mitigationNO: Jobb med Inputs etablerte nordiske logistikknettverk

risks.risk: Inventory availability varies by country - Finland may have limited reuse market
risks.mitigation: Hub model: Source centrally from Sweden, distribute to other Nordic locations
risks.riskNO: Lagertilgjengelighet varierer etter land - Finland kan ha begrenset gjenbruksmarked
risks.mitigationNO: Hub-modell: Kilde sentralt fra Sverige, distribuer til andre nordiske lokasjoner

keyConsiderations: Input Interiör is only supplier with verified pan-Nordic presence
Fire regulations differ across Nordic countries - require country-specific mapping
Hub-and-spoke model (source from Sweden, distribute) is most viable
Framework agreements essential for multi-location pricing consistency
Build longer timeline (12-18 months) for coordination complexity
keyConsiderationsNO: Input Interiör er eneste leverandør med verifisert pan-nordisk tilstedeværelse
Brannreguleringer varierer på tvers av nordiske land - krever landsspesifikk kartlegging
Hub-and-spoke modell (kilde fra Sverige, distribuer) er mest levedyktig
Rammeavtaler essensielt for flerlokasjon priskonsistens
Bygg lengre tidslinje (12-18 måneder) for koordineringskompleksitet

title: Fire-Critical Public Spaces
description: Public areas with strict fire safety compliance (lobbies, corridors, restaurants)
descriptionNO: Offentlige områder med strenge brannsikkerhetskrav (lobbyer, korridorer, restauranter)
context: Renovation of fire-critical spaces requiring Swedish BBR Chapter 5 compliance
contextNO: Renovering av brannkritiske rom som krever svensk BBR Kapittel 5 overholdelse

tier1.use: Corridors, escape routes, high-traffic public areas
tier1.furniture: Metal/glass furniture, solid wood furniture, concrete/stone decor
tier1.furnitureNO: Metall/glass møbler, solid tre-møbler, betong/stein dekor
tier1.testing: Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) only - no flame testing
tier1.testingNO: Kun Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) - ingen flammetesting

tier2.use: Restaurants, conference rooms, lobbies (NOT escape corridors)
tier2.furniture: Reupholstered furniture with NEW fire-rated fabrics (Kvadrat, Gabriel, Maharam)
tier2.furnitureNO: Remøblert møbler med NYE brannsikre tekstiler (Kvadrat, Gabriel, Maharam)

tier3.use: AVOID in escape routes - use in guest rooms instead
tier3.useNO: UNNGÅ i fluktveier - bruk i gjesteværelser isteden
tier3.furniture: Fully upholstered vintage furniture (sofas, lounge chairs)
tier3.recommendation: Relocate to guest rooms (lower fire requirements)

tier1and2.name: YLLW FACTORY
tier1and2.capability: Full Tier 1 & 2 - metal/wood furniture + reupholstery with fire-rated fabrics, RISE/SP testing coordination

tier1and2.name: INPUT INTERIÖR
tier1and2.capability: Tier 1 & 2 - can arrange EN 1021 testing via partners

tier1and2.name: REKOMO AB
tier1and2.capability: Tier 1 only - metal/wood furniture, no fire testing coordination

timeline: 8-10 weeks minimum for fire testing coordination (start during design phase)
timelineNO: 8-10 uker minimum for branntesting-koordinering (start i designfasen)
estimatedCost: +15-25% cost increase for Tier 2 reupholstered furniture with fire-rated fabrics
estimatedCostNO: +15-25% kostnadsøkning for Tier 2 remøblert møbler med brannsikre tekstiler
criticalSuccessFactors: Design fire-critical spaces around Tier 1 & Tier 2 reuse
Relocate Tier 3 items to guest rooms (D-s2,d0 requirements)
Start testing during design development (8-10 week buffer)
Engage fire consultant early (Piacon, White Arkitekter)
Leverage sprinkler systems for equivalence pathways (precedent: Ett Hem, Hobo Hotel)
criticalSuccessFactorsNO: Design brannkritiske rom rundt Tier 1 & Tier 2 gjenbruk
Flytt Tier 3 gjenstander til gjesteværelser (D-s2,d0 krav)
Start testing i design-utviklingsfasen (8-10 ukers buffer)
Engasjer brannskonsulent tidlig (Piacon, White Arkitekter)
Utnytt sprinklersystemer for ekvivalensmuligheter (presedens: Ett Hem, Hobo Hotel)

risks.risk: Tier 3 furniture testing costs prohibitive (45-70K SEK per product)
risks.mitigation: Avoid Tier 3 in public areas - relocate vintage upholstered furniture to guest rooms
risks.riskNO: Tier 3 møbler testing kostnader uoverkommelige (45-70K SEK per produkt)
risks.mitigationNO: Unngå Tier 3 i offentlige områder - flytt vintage polstret møbler til gjesteværelser

risks.risk: Fire authority approval delays if vintage upholstery used in corridors
risks.riskNO: Brannmyndighet godkjenningsforsinkelser hvis vintage polstring brukes i korridorer

risks.risk: Upholstered furniture refurbishment timeline (8-12 weeks) delays project
risks.mitigation: Begin fire testing and refurbishment during design phase, not construction
risks.riskNO: Polstret møbler remøblerings-tidslinje (8-12 uker) forsinker prosjekt
risks.mitigationNO: Begynn branntesting og remøblering i designfasen, ikke konstruksjon

keyConsiderations: Fire safety is legal requirement - cannot be compromised
Three-tier system balances compliance with circular economy goals
Tier 1 (metal/wood) safest for corridors - minimal testing burden
Tier 2 (reupholstery) viable for restaurants/lobbies with EN 1021 testing
Tier 3 (vintage upholstery) should be relocated to guest rooms
Sprinkler systems enable alternative compliance pathways
Early fire consultant engagement prevents costly redesigns
keyConsiderationsNO: Brannsikkerhet er lovkrav - kan ikke kompromitteres
Tre-tier system balanserer overholdelse med sirkulærøkonomi-mål
Tier 1 (metall/tre) sikreste for korridorer - minimal testing-byrde
Tier 2 (remøblering) levedyktig for restauranter/lobbyer med EN 1021 testing
Tier 3 (vintage polstring) bør flyttes til gjesteværelser
Sprinklersystemer muliggjør alternative overholdelsesveier
Tidlig brannskonsulent-engasjement forhindrer kostbare redesign

precedents.approach: Vintage upholstered furniture in guest rooms via sprinkler + compartmentation
